topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploying the VRSvApp

p.i: Return to the Installing the KVM + ESX Deployment.

body.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade in the KVM + ESX Deployment requires the VRSvApp. One VRSvApp is required for each ESX host. There is a 1-to-1 mapping between each VRSvApp and its ESX host. The VRSvApp installation package is contained in the packages you downloaded from DCN.
Important: You must disable vMotion for the VRSvApp to prevent the VRS VM from moving from the ESX host. in case of failure of the host in the ESX cluster.
To disable vMotion for the VRSvApp:

ol.li: Iin the vSphere Client, right-click the VRSvApp and select Edit Settings.
For each VRSvApp, select Disabled from the tAutomation Level list.
Click OK to save the settings.

Copy the downloaded VRS_3.2.2-74.ovf and VRS_3.2.2-74-disk1.vmdk files from HLM host to VSD node in the /opt/vsd directory. For more information on downloading DCN files, see Download packages for KVM + ESX.
Extract DCN-VRS-VMware-3.0R7.zip file to the /opt/vsd/rsanghvi/CloudMgmt-vmware-working/ directory.

Change to the directory where you extracted the files, for example:cd /opt/vsd/rsanghvi/CloudMgmt-vmware-working/
The vrs-metafile.config file is in the extracted files.

Modify the vrs-metafile.config using values appropriate for your environment. See the example config file.
Important: The values in this files are case sensitive and errors will cause the installation to stop.

Run the command to deploy the template using the example below after making changes to file paths to match your environment, vCenter username, vCenter password and vCenter IP address: ./cli.bash deploy_vrs -f /opt/vsd/CloudMgmt-vmware/<VRS-Template.ovf> -m /opt/vsd/CloudMgmt-vmware/vrs-metafile.config -p <vcenter password> -u <vcenter user> --url https://<vecenter IP>/sdk
Where:usage: -f,--path <PATH> VRS template path. -m,--metafile <FILE> Meta file defining VRS property values. -p,--password <PASSWORD> vCenter password. -r,--resourcepool <RESOURCEPOOL> Resource pool name or moref. (Optional) -u,--username <USRNAME> vCenter user name. --url <URL> vCenter url (example: https://localhost/sdk)
Syntax Helpusage: deploy_vrs [-d <DATASTORE>] -f <PATH> -m <FILE> -p <PASSWORD> [-r <RESOURCEPOOL>] â€“u <USRNAME> --url <URL> -d,--datastore <DATASTORE> Datastore name or moref. (Optional) -f,--path <PATH> VRS template path. -m,--metafile <FILE> Meta file defining VRS property values. -p,--password <PASSWORD> vCenter password. -r,--resourcepool <RESOURCEPOOL> Resource pool name or moref. (Optional) -u,--username <USRNAME> vCenter user name. --url <URL> vCenter url (example: https://localhost/sdk)

Use the vSpenere client to power on the VRSvApp.
This process must be performed for each ESX host.
